Talon::

Talon woke up and started to look after Tucson.

From: Sandy Panic=
o 
Sent: Saturday, August 06, 2011 2:26 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subj=
ect: Re: Rise of the Silver Dragon




Tucson continues Eastward in the dir=
ection Rodimus was pointing.  The wind was strong and fast enough to carry =
him on outstretched wings as he glides swiftly across the darkening sky.  T=
hen a faint scent catches his nostrils.  

" We're in the right direction, =
Rodimus.  I can smell him.  Neither Maximal, Autobot, Decepticon or Predaco=
n.  It's far more foul than that.  I believe I've just locked in on our que=
ry. " 

A mighty dragon on the hunt, Tucson swiftly flies onward and spots =
a mech floating in the air, hovering.  Not having encountered Saberback, he=
 stops and circles the area around him.  

" Rodimus, be ready.  Leo Prime,=
 We're here.  I have the enemy sighted."

Tucson makes himself heard with a=
 very loud roar.

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug 6, =
2011, at 3:08 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:


    
  =
> <OLD - TUSCON, RAT TRAP, QUICKSTRIDE>

  > Tucson edges close to the edge=
 of the cave's cliff and nods to Leo Prime.
  > He then looks over the clif=
f. He realizes this will be the first time he
  > takes actual flight. With=
 a sigh he shows a determined look as he prepares
  > to step off the cliff=
 with fully extended wings. He had no idea what to do,
  > since he was for=
 most of his life, on wheels instead of wings.
  >
  > " Rodimus, bare with=
 me, this is my first flight. Hold on!"
  >
  > He bites the bullet and beg=
ins with a strong beat of his wings, as he lifts
  > his body off the groun=
d. By instinct he curls up his front and hind legs as
  > he gets higher in=
 the air. The higher he gets the more draft he experiences
  > until he is =
able to soar on outstretched wings without beating them. He
  > holds his l=
ong neck out straight and uses his long tail as a rudder which
  > keeps hi=
m perfectly balanced in the air. He finds himself speeding past his
  > com=
rades which surprises him.
  >
  > " Leo Prime wasn't joking, I can't belie=
ve I'm capable of traveling this
  > fast. All right, I'm gathering intel f=
rom the ground, and I believe we're
  > on the right flight path. Now let's=
 give our query something that will
  > cause them to turn their head."
  >=

  > As he had done at the cave, Tucson releases a strong throated roar whi=
ch
  > could very well be heard by enemy forces.
  >
  > Back at the Ark, R=
attrap and Quickstride hears the roar.
  >
  > " What the pit was that!?"
 =
 >
  > Rattrap yelps as his comrade grins.
  >
  > " That? Oh, Tucson got a=
 major upgrade. Nice voice he's got huh? Oh if ya
  > see a big silver drag=
on, that's him."
  >
  > Rattrap looks up.
  >
  > " Wow so he traded his w=
heels for wings.. Aww maan now he needs a new
  > handle!"

  <NEW - RODIMU=
S, LEO, WING CALIBER>

  As TUSCON flew through the air, his giant wings be=
ating the air
  RODIMUS was trying to hang on for dear life! Being a land b=
ound mech
  he very rarely got a chance to be in the air, except for the
  =
occasional shuttle ride. At the same time though RODIMUS couldn't
  escape =
a feeling of exhilaration as the wind tore at him and the giant
  dragon th=
at was now TUSCON moved and turned.

  "So where are we headed?" RODIMUS sa=
id over comlink as he didn't think
  his voice would carry well over the so=
und of the wind whipping past
  them. "From the reports, the dinosaurs were=
 several hundred miles in
  that direction." RODIMUS was Pointing in a gene=
rally eastward
  direction.

  All around them, as far as the optic could s=
can there were trees and
  rolling grasses. To the south a desert stretch w=
as forming but it was
  some distance away. It would take centuries for it =
to reach the area
  they were located. There was a string of mountains that=
 ran generally
  north to south with a stong branch running off to the west=
, places
  that would one day be called the Cascade range and the Blue Moun=
tains.

  The skies were beginning to darken as well. Night was beginning t=
o set
  in, the first stars were already making their appearance in the dus=
ky
  skies.

  (TAG)

  Preston
